com.noctarius.borabora

Interface Dictionary

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Iterable<Map.Entry<Value,Value>>

    public interface Dictionary
extends Iterable<Map.Entry<Value,Value>>

    A Dictionary is a map of key-value data items. Dictionaries are also known as tables, maps, hashes or objects (as in JSON).

    Dictionary implementations are lazy evaluating and just pre-evaluate the basic information like key-value pair stream positions for direct access to certain elements.

    In contrast to a Java Map keys are matched using Predicate classes since objects are not eagerly deserialized / read. Additionally the dictionary supports 64bit indexes sizes.

    See Also:
    Value

      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Returns a string-based representation of the internal CBOR bytestream as a human-readable version.
      boolean containsKey(Predicate<Value> predicate)
      Matches keys of entries against the provided Predicate matcher implementation and returns true if a match is found, otherwise false.
      boolean containsValue(Predicate<Value> predicate)
      Matches values of entries against the provided Predicate matcher implementation and returns true if a match is found, otherwise false.

      Returns a lazy evaluating Iterable implementation to traverse all entries (key-value pairs) in the dictionary represented by this instance.
      default void forEach(BiConsumer<Value,Value> action)
      Performs the given action for each entry in this map until all entries have been processed or the action throws an exception.
      Value get(Predicate<Value> predicate)
      Matches keys of entries against the provided Predicate matcher implementation and returns the value if a match is found, other null.
      boolean isEmpty()
      Returns the empty state of the dictionary.
      boolean isIndefinite()
      Returns true if the underlying CBOR stream is lazily evaluated and this dictionary is an indefinite marked data item, otherwise it will return false.

      Returns a lazy evaluating Iterator implementation to traverse all entries in the dictionary represented by this instance.

      Returns a lazy evaluating Iterable implementation to traverse all keys in the dictionary represented by this instance.
      long size()
      Returns the size of the dictionary in number of key-value pairs (entries), not elements in the stream.
      StreamableIterable<Value> values()
      Returns a lazy evaluating Iterable implementation to traverse all values in the dictionary represented by this instance.

      • Methods inherited from interface java.lang.Iterable

        forEach, spliterator

    • Method Detail

      • size

        long size()
        Returns the size of the dictionary in number of key-value pairs (entries), not elements in the stream. The parser is free to decide to return -1 in case of large indefinite dictionaries. In this case the stream will be walked element by element instead of based on the size of the dictionary when matching for keys or values.
        Returns:
        the number of entries in the dictionary or may return -1 for large indefinite dictionaries

      • isEmpty

        boolean isEmpty()
        Returns the empty state of the dictionary. The empty state is defined by size to be unequal to 0. This is true for indefinite and known-length dictionaries. Also size equals to -1 means non-empty.
        Returns:
        true if the dictionary is empty, otherwise false

      • containsKey

        boolean containsKey(Predicate<Value> predicate)

        Matches keys of entries against the provided Predicate matcher implementation and returns true if a match is found, otherwise false.

        This process is lazy and stops whenever the first key matches. According to the CBOR specification, dictionaries are allowed to support the same key multiple times, the support on parser side, however, is not strictly required and skipped for this implementation.

        The scanning process can be pretty expensive and if the value is needed afterwards, it is recommended to use get(Predicate) directly as the cost is similar but since no caching takes place, using both methods after another, the cost is multiplied by the number of operations.

        Parameters:
        predicate - the Predicate to match the key
        Returns:
        true if the key is found, otherwise false

      • containsValue

        boolean containsValue(Predicate<Value> predicate)

        Matches values of entries against the provided Predicate matcher implementation and returns true if a match is found, otherwise false.

        This process is lazy and stops whenever the first value matches.

        Parameters:
        predicate - the Predicate to match the value
        Returns:
        true if the value if found, otherwise false

      • get

        Value get(Predicate<Value> predicate)

        Matches keys of entries against the provided Predicate matcher implementation and returns the value if a match is found, other null.

        This process is lazy and stops whenever the first key matches. According to the CBOR specification, dictionaries are allowed to support the same key multiple times, the support on parser side, however, is not strictly required and skipped for this implementation.

        Parameters:
        predicate - the Predicate to match the key
        Returns:
        true if the key is found, otherwise false

      • keys

        StreamableIterable<Value> keys()

        Returns a lazy evaluating Iterable implementation to traverse all keys in the dictionary represented by this instance. Also the Iterator returned from Iterable.iterator() is a fully lazy implementation. Whenever the traversal ends, no more elements will be evaluated.

        Returns:
        a a fully lazy, keys traversing Iterable instance

      • values

        StreamableIterable<Value> values()

        Returns a lazy evaluating Iterable implementation to traverse all values in the dictionary represented by this instance. Also the Iterator returned from Iterable.iterator() is a fully lazy implementation. Whenever the traversal ends, no more elements will be evaluated.

        Returns:
        a a fully lazy, values traversing Iterable instance

      • entries

        StreamableIterable<Map.Entry<Value,Value>> entries()

        Returns a lazy evaluating Iterable implementation to traverse all entries (key-value pairs) in the dictionary represented by this instance. Also the Iterator returned from Iterable.iterator() is a fully lazy implementation. Whenever the traversal ends, no more elements will be evaluated.

        Returns:
        a a fully lazy, entries traversing Iterable instance

      • iterator

        Iterator<Map.Entry<Value,Value>> iterator()

        Returns a lazy evaluating Iterator implementation to traverse all entries in the dictionary represented by this instance. That means, whenever the traversal ends, no more elements will be evaluated.

        Specified by:
        iterator in interface Iterable<Map.Entry<Value,Value>>
        Returns:
        a a fully lazy, entries traversing Iterator instance

      • asString

        String asString()
        Returns a string-based representation of the internal CBOR bytestream as a human-readable version.
        Returns:
        human-readable representation of the CBOR stream

      • isIndefinite

        boolean isIndefinite()
        Returns true if the underlying CBOR stream is lazily evaluated and this dictionary is an indefinite marked data item, otherwise it will return false.
        Returns:
        true if the dictionary is indefinite and lazily evaluated, otherwise false

      • forEach

        default void forEach(BiConsumer<Value,Value> action)
        Performs the given action for each entry in this map until all entries have been processed or the action throws an exception. Unless otherwise specified by the implementing class, actions are performed in the order of entry set iteration (if an iteration order is specified.) Exceptions thrown by the action are relayed to the caller.
        Parameters:
        action - The action to be performed for each entry
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the specified action is null
